newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australia's NSW plans A$1 bln TAB float-paper says.
newsitem.headline: Australia's NSW plans A$1 bln TAB float-paper says.

text.p: The New South Wales state government would announce the A$1 billion public float of the horse racing betting agency, the Totalisator Agency Board (TAB), later on Tuesday, The Sydney Morning Herald newspaper said.
The government had also decided to include a lucrative poker-machine jackpot licence to lift the value of the sale, the Herald said.

"Advisers told the Government that without the lure of an additional gambling income, the TAB was an asset of diminishing value and would not return to the government the sale price of about A$1 billion initially envisaged," it said.
The paper said the float would contain a sweetener for investors by linking poker machines around the state to central jackpot pools.
"Despite a market analysis that a trade sale of the TAB was cheaper to arrange and would probably return a higher price, the Government opted for a public float," the newspaper said.
"Sources last night said this was because a float would prove politically more popular since it would be seen as being inclusive of the public, particularly the State's punters," it said.

Gaming machine operator AWA Ltd, Kerry Packer's media and gambling group Publishing and Broadcasting Ltd and Victorian gambling group Tabcorp Holdings Ltd were all seen as likely bidders in a trade sale.
Tabcorp told Reuters in January this year it wanted to buy 75 percent of the New South Wales TAB.
